page.title: 14FOREST OF DEAN SPEECH HOUSE
page.content:
THE SPEECH HOUSE WAS BUILT AS A LODGE IN 1670 AND IT WAS HERE THAT THE VERDERERS COURT WAS HELD.
IT IS NOW A T.H.F. HOTEL RENTED FROM THE CROWN. IT HAS 13 ROOMS TO LET, COSTING FROM Â£37 TO Â£43 PER NIGHT FOR A DOUBLE ROOM. A CHILD SLEEPING IN THE SAME ROOM WOULD NOT PAY. PETS ARE ALLOWED IN THE ROOMS. MANY ROOMS ARE NAMED AFTER TREES. IN OAK ROOM THERE IS A T.V., CHAIRS, BASIN, TEA & COFFEE MAKING EQUIPMENT AND A HUGE FOUR POSTER BED THAT 5 PEOPLE COULD GET INTO, ALSO A GARDEN VIEW.
THERE IS A GHOST IN NUMBER 15. ONLY VISITORS SEE HIM. HE WAKES THE VISITOR JUST BEFORE MIDNIGHT, SMOKES A PIPE & THEN DISAPPEARS.
